column4: you don't have to download a cd to update the distro each time, right?
what's the diff between updating the distro and all the pkg's?
because before doing the dist-upgrade you change which repositories you're looking in
oh ok.. so do dist-upgrade first?
well i have a old ubuntu cd, and don't wanna download a new one...
aha. well, what you'll do is edit your /etc/apt/sources.list so that instead of "breezy" or "hoary" it says "dapper"
you'll see what i'm talking about
alright... then just do apt-get dist-upgrade ?
so apt-get update updates all the pkgs, then apt-get upgrade updates the mirrors?
no...sudo apt-get update downloads the latest list of packages (the most up-to-date one available in the repositories in the /etc/apt/sources.list)
and then sudo apt-get upgrade upgrades any packages
and sudo apt-get dist-upgrade upgrades your whole system
